message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.AR. 

The paper deals with the beam alignment problem in millimeter-wave distributed antenna systems, which is a topic related to information theory (cs.IT) and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). The proposed two-stage schedule-and-align (TSSA) scheme involves user scheduling and beam search, which can be considered as a control and optimization problem in system engineering (cs.SY). The use of distributed remote radio units (RRUs) also suggests a potential connection to multimedia (cs.MM) and computer architecture (cs.AR) subcategories.
